intro: Diploknema butyraceoides, commonly known as the African butter tree, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and alternate, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by fleshy, orange-red berries containing a single seed. It is often found in moist, shaded forest understories and is valued for its edible seeds and ornamental appeal. The tree also has traditional uses in local medicine and as a source of oil.
